intro: Cynoglossum hirsutum, commonly known as hairy tongue of the sky, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, known for its distinctive blue flowers and sometimes hairy foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Cynoglossum hirsutum is also known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional remedies.
